normalised: **Electric Vehicle Charging Gets a Bollywood Twist!**

unnormalised: Hey folks, are you tired of range anxiety in your electric gaadi? Well, cheer up! IIT-Delhi is cooking up something interesting in the EV charging space. Word on the street is they're developing faster and more efficient charging tech, potentially cutting charging times drastically. Imagine, Mumbai to Pune in your Tata Nexon EV without the long pit stops!
normalised: Hey folks, are you tired of range anxiety in your electric gaadi? Well, cheer up! Indian Institute of Technology-Delhi is cooking up something interesting in the Electric Vehicle charging space. Word on the street is they're developing faster and more efficient charging tech, potentially cutting charging times drastically. Imagine, Mumbai to Pune in your Tata Nexon Electric Vehicle without the long pit stops!

unnormalised: But that's not all! Remember the iconic "Dil Chahta Hai" road trip? Well, soon, that Goa trip might be totally emissions-free. Several startups are setting up EV charging grids along major highways, including NH48, so you can cruise in style, guilt-free.
normalised: But that's not all! Remember the iconic "Dil Chahta Hai" road trip? Well, soon, that Goa trip might be totally emissions-free. Several startups are setting up Electric Vehicle charging grids along major highways, including National Highway forty eight, so you can cruise in style, guilt-free.

unnormalised: Plus, government subsidies are still in place. You can snag a charger for your home in Bangalore for around Rs. 15,000 after subsidies. Talk about a bargain!
normalised: Plus, government subsidies are still in place. You can snag a charger for your home in Bangalore for around rupee fifteen thousand after subsidies. Talk about a bargain!

unnormalised: Experts are predicting a huge surge in EV adoption in the next couple of years, making charging infrastructure more critical than ever. Some companies are even planning charging stations at local kirana stores. Talk about convenience! Soon, stopping for chai and a charge will be the new norm.
normalised: Experts are predicting a huge surge in Electric Vehicle adoption in the next couple of years, making charging infrastructure more critical than ever.
